stem: A 24-year-old woman develops wheezing and shortness of breath when she is exposed to cold air or when she is exercising. She has noticed that these symptoms are becoming worse over the past few weeks. Which of the following is the agent of choice for the treatment of symptomatic relief?
disc:
Exercise-induced bronchoconstriction is a type of acute bronchospasm that occurs during or shortly after exercise. In fact here, exercise acts as a trigger in people with underlying asthma.

In these patients, the initial drug of choice for quick symptomatic relief is inhaled short-acting beta 2 agonists
